titles.title: Not Worthy, Lord, to Gather Up the Crumbs

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Not worthy, Lord, to gather up the crumbs With trembling hand that from Thy table fall, A weary, heavy laden sinner comes To plead Thy promise and obey Thy call.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I am not worthy to be thought Thy child, Nor sit the last and lowest at Thy board; Too long a wanderer and too oft beguiled; I only ask one reconciling word.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: One word from Thee, my Lord, one smile, one look, And I could face the cold, rough world again; And with that treasure in my heart could brook The wrath of devils and the scorn of men.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: And is not mercy Thy prerogative\Free mercy, boundless, fathomless, divine? Me, Lord, the chief of sinners, me forgive, And Thine the greater glory, only Thine.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: I hear Thy voice; Thou bid'st me come and rest; I come, I kneel, I clasp Thy pierc√®d feet; Thou bid'st me take my place, a welcome guest Among Thy saints, and of Thy banquet eat.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
My praise can only breathe itself in prayer,
My prayer can only lose itself in Thee;
Dwell Thou forever in my heart, and there,
Lord, let me sup with Thee; sup Thou with me.
